recordings.loc: Road past Engikaret, Monduli, Arusha Region

recordings.rmk: About 10 of them near the side of the road on a telephone line. The area is near a beach. They looked like pied wagtails and I strongly suspect they were but for their behaviour which was almost that of a bee-eater so I am not quite sure.
a group of bird roosting in a tree
Probably saw the bird as there were many kinds.
The bird was perched on a rooftop and made calls in between morning ablutions. Head appeared gray and breast was white. Followed a pied wagtail when it flew by. It was not a barbet.
A pair of these birds seen bringing in nesting material to a gap in a large rock in the middle of the river in spring. Editing done to quieten the noise of the flowing river.
Can anyone help me ID this chattery call? Not the Silvery-cheeked Hornbill.
